results.firPara: Rafael Benítezs Newcastle United may be favourites to win the Championship but Nigel Pearson should not be discounted as he strives to lead a talented Derby County squad back into the top flight

results.firPara: With no replacement for manager Steve Bruce appointed, only one summer signing and fans angry with the clubs owners, is there any hope for Hull?
results.secPara: With no replacement for manager Steve Bruce appointed, only one summer signing and fans angry with the clubs owners, is there any hope for Hull?
results.webTitle: Premier League 2016-17 preview No7: Hull City | Louise Taylor

results.firPara: Chelsea closed their tour of the United States with a 3-1 win over Milan in Minneapolis as their manager Antonio Conte prepared to clear out the players he no longer wants.
results.secPara: Bertrand Traoré opened the scoring for Contes side, while Oscars double sealed the victory after Giacomo Bonaventura had drawn Milan level.
results.webTitle: Antonio Conte set for player clearout after Chelsea see off Milan
Football transfer rumours: Arsenal to sign Riyad Mahrez and Julian Draxler?

results.firPara: And thats it. A comfortable win for Chelsea. The game was even - in scoreline and performances - at half-time but Chelsea were by far the better team in the second 45 minutes, with Oscar and Hazard in particular causing problems for the Italians.
results.secPara: 90 min Two minutes of added time.
results.webTitle: Chelsea 3-1 Milan: International Champions Cup – as it happened

results.firPara: Carli Lloyd began this Olympic tournament as she ended the last one scoring in an American victory.
results.secPara: The match-winner in the final at Wembley four years ago needed only nine minutes to find the net as the US eased to victory over New Zealand in their opening group game. Always composed and in control, the performance was efficient rather than thrilling, as routine as could be for the favourites.
results.webTitle: USA get easy win in Rio opener as crowd taunts Hope Solo with Zika chants

results.firPara: An easy victory for the reigning champions, thanks to goals from Carli Lloyd and Alex Morgan
results.secPara: b>Well, thats 12 Olympic wins in a row for the US womens team, and it was pretty straightforward. New Zealand fought hard, but the gulf in class was stark, and USA didnt need to over-exert themselves. It wasnt a classic, but there were two good goals to savor, the first from Carli Lloyd and the second from Alex Morgan, and USA get their campaign off to a solid start. Thanks for reading. Bye!
results.webTitle: Rio 2016 women's football: USA 2-0 New Zealand – as it happened

results.firPara: It was Wayne Rooneys night and so José Mourinho took a back seat for his first home game as the Manchester United manager – arriving without fanfare, leaving without a press conference – but this summers other big name arrival at Old Trafford made his presence felt in an otherwise tame goalless testimonial against Everton.
results.secPara: I think every big player can work with other big players, said Zlatan Ibrahimovic before kick-off. First impressions at Old Trafford suggest that was not simply another tribute to the United captain.
results.webTitle: Zlatan Ibrahimovic dovetails with United captain in Rooney testimonial

results.firPara: • Gunners face Viking on Thursday and Manchester City on Sunday
results.secPara: Arsène Wenger will include Alexis Sánchez and Aaron Ramsey in his party for Arsenals friendlies in Scandinavia against Viking FK and Manchester City as he looks to get them into shape for the Premier League opener at home to Liverpool on Sunday week.
results.webTitle: Arsenal include Sánchez and Ramsey in squad for trip to Scandinavia
